Deficiency Narrative: A staff member put a vehicle in drive and stopped the vehicle while a child attempted to get into the vehicle, resulting in a child receiving an injury.
Correction Narrative: A staff member put a vehicle in drive and stopped the vehicle while a child attempted to get into the vehicle, resulting in a child receiving an injury.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not report the first quarter EBI data timely.
Correction Narrative: RCCR Inspector spoke with the operation about compliance. Staff will create calendar reminders and will assign multiple workers to the reminders to ensure data gets submitted timely. Compliance has been met for this standard.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's service plan did not document detailed information telling a caregiver how to observe and keep watch over a child in care.
Correction Narrative:
The operation asked for more time to come into compliance. Extension was approved by RCCR Supervisor and new compliance date was changed to April 26, 2024.

The operation hosted a training for their caregivers on April 30, 2024. The training went over child plan documentation instructions for the level of supervision needed for each child in care. The sign-in sheet was reviewed to confirm the participation of staff. The operation assigned a staff member to ensure each caregiver understands the supervision plan for each child.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's fire iinspection has expired on 08/10/23.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator indicating that they have created a check list of all annual inspections to ensure they are not missed.  A copy of the check list was received.  The fire inspection was completed on 08/28/23.  A copy of the inspection was received.

Deficiency Narrative: Two files that were reviewed did not have the dental results documented.
Correction Narrative: An email was received by the Administrator indicating that they have put in place a new procedure regarding ensuring all medical and dental documentation has the results of the visit.  She will be the final staff to review all documentations before they are filed in the file.

Deficiency Narrative: There were no documentations regarding weekly preliminary discharge planning reviews.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator stating that they have created a form for the placing agency to fill out regarding the discharge planning review.  A copy of the form was received.  They will be requesting weekly updates.

Deficiency Narrative: There was medication in the refrigerator that was not locked up.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The child's service plan did not give a comprehensive description, of what the supervision should entail.
Correction Narrative: RCCR Inspector received an email from the Administrator.  It indicates that the Administrator will ensure that all service plans have a thorough details regarding the childrenÂ’s supervision needs.  The service plan will highlight in detail what specific issues the children are dealing with and how to address it and the timeframe.  A copy of the updated service plan was received.  A safety plan was also attached regarding supervision for one of the children in care.  This was to address the supervision plan for the child and children are safe.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was not completing the place extension documentation by the timeframe required.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received from the operation with copies of the 16 days monthly notes.  They stated that this is their placement extension.  They did send a copy of what they place in the child's file. An inspection will be conducted on 12/06/22 to review all children's files who have been there more than 15 days for the placement extension. 
An inspection was completed on 12/06/22 and confirmed that the extension documentation was completed for the children that have been at the operation more than 15 days.

Deficiency Narrative: The level of supervision was not listed on two service plans that were reviewed.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator stating that all service plans will be reviewed in detail by the Administrator regarding all areas, especially supervision.  This will include supervision inside and outside of the home for the children in care.  A training was provided on 12/15/22 and the sign in sheet was received.

Deficiency Narrative:
There were three serious incident reports that were not completed.  

748.311(4) 2 out of 3 did not have the adults that were involved. 
748.311(8) 2 out of 3 did not have follow up interventions. 
448.311(9) 3 out of 3 did not have the threating health care provider.
On the day of the outing the water to the swimming pool was not clear.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email stating that Bridge The gap will ensure that going forward the girls will  use a public pool with city regulations, if staff notices issues with the water, or the pool not being clear they will immediately vacate the premises. The staff were trained on 06/22/22.

Deficiency Narrative: Two medications were not given as prescribed to a child.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: On 1/13/22, there was not a signature or initials of who administered the medication to one child.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator stating that all staff completed a training on 02/01/22 regarding medication documentation.  A copy of the sign in sheet was received.  In addition, the Administrator will conduct daily audits to ensure all medication logs are completed correctly.  They will complete a medication log error form when needed.

Deficiency Narrative:
There was one caregiver that did not have a current first aid training.  

The caregiver did complete the training during the inspection.
The Health Inspection expired on 12/4/21.
Correction Narrative: On 1/21/22, the Owner's stated that they have contacted the inspector and trying to get an inspection scheduled. On 1/25/22, the Owner's stated they have an inspection scheduled for 1/27/22.  Inspector did receive an updated inspection and it was approved. The operation stated they will ensure that they put a check list in place for annual inspections that are due.

Deficiency Narrative: The discharge summary did not have the address or phone number to whom the child was being discharged to.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: There were several medical logs that were reviewed that did not have the date and time the medication was given.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of two files that were read did not have known allergies listed on the exterior of the child's record.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Several children was not given their medication as prescribed by their doctor.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The agency had not validated their background list since they were issued a permit.
There were two children's medication logs that were reviewed and it did not have who administered the medication for dates 9/24/21, 9/25/21 and 9/27/21.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The discharge summary did not have the frequency of the three medications that the child was taking.
Correction Narrative: The standard was evaluated and in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of two files that were read did not have a signature on the Child Rights indicating that they received a copy of the rights or that it was discussed with them.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff file that was reviewed did not have the following items: 748.363(1) date of employment, 748.363(3) job description, 748.363(6) a notarized affidavit, and 748.363(9) proof of background eligibility.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's medication log did not have the prescribing physician noted.  In addition standard 748.2151(c)(4) was reviewed and the strength of the medication was not documented.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received from the owners stating they will ensure the medication has properly been administered, BTG will execute the following steps effective immediately:
1.) The prescribing health-care professional's name from discharging facility, will be included on the medication log upon admission.
2.) BTG will record the medication strength on medication log upon admission from discharging facility.
3.) BTG will ensure all steps are complete upon admission by using a checklist to prevent incomplete documentation.
4.) Program managers will conduct an admission audit within 72 of admission to ensure all forms are completed in the child file.

Deficiency Narrative: One child did not have record of TB testing.
Correction Narrative: An email was received stating that the child that needed a TB has an appointment scheduled for 8/17/21. Due to the child having COVID, this is the earliest it can be completed.  The CPS worker was contacted, and she had no documentation that the child received one in the past.  The operation stated they will ensure when a child is placed, they will ensure they request a copy of the TB.

Deficiency Narrative: The agency did not have the permit posted.

The budget had 0 in several expense columns even though the plan was to have children in care.  Several costs were staggered even though the income was for full capacity from month 1.  Capacity was reduced so the budget needs to be adjusted.
Correction Narrative: An email was receiving from consultant with a current budget estimate. This was uploaded onto the share point.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not provide a floor plan that had the correct floor plan dimension  .
Correction Narrative: An email was received from Consultant with a new floor plans with the correct square footage dimensions.  The floor plan was uploaded onto the share point.

Deficiency Narrative: The policies did not have the required annual EBI training hours for the caregivers.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from Consultant with the new EBI policy including training.

Deficiency Narrative: The policies did not include the overnight policies and the job description of the volunteer with the children care.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from consultant with the polices and job description for the volunteers and the overnight polices regarding volunteers.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not have the job description of the PLSP staff and COO/program manager in their policies.  Operation provided it at the time of the inspection.
